meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>coloring</kanji> so the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to color something</vocabulary>, because you're doing coloring.
readingMnemonic: You go <vocabulary>to color something</vocabulary>, painting the coloring all over the wall. Problem is, the coloring is made of ACID. This causes the wall to <reading>erode</reading> (いろど).
